page.title: 11Schooling in Wolsingham
page.content: The{Comprehensive School,}developed out of a Grammar School founded in 1614,is the only local authority school for pupils aged 11 to 18.It has 1200 pupils housed on two adjacent sites with buildings opened in 1911 and 1959. The{County Junior School}in Upper Town has 8 classes for the seven age groups as well as a nursery unit and trainer pool. { St Thomas' R.C. School}has 28 primary pupils in two classes,drawn from all Weardale.In 1987 the school will close when a new school is opened at nearby Tow Law. { St Anne's Convent School}is an independent school run by the Sisters of Mercy for girls of all denominations aged 4_16.From 1985 it will operate as a day school only.
